Urine Tests
                
A health care provider may order the following urine tests to help determine if a child has kidney damage from hemolytic uremic syndrome.
                
Dipstick test for albumin. A dipstick test performed on a urine sample can detect the presence of albumin in the urine, which could mean kidney damage. The child or caretaker collects a urine sample in a special container in a health care
